item.title: Mini-Series - Dev Interview #1
item.author: CaptV0rt3x
item.description: Hey there, people! This is a new mini-series of dev interviews, with which we sneak a peek into the lives of our developers.

item.title: yuzu Patreon Preview Release June 12th
item.author: flamesage
item.description: Good day, yuzu fans! Today we bring you another exciting yuzu update with the June 2019 Patreon Preview Release! We heard your feedback - this time around, we have some major graphical fixes!

item.title: New Feature - Boxcat
item.author: CaptV0rt3x
item.description: Good day, yuzu fans! Today we bring you another exciting Switch feature which will create opportunities, for new in-game content across various games! Without further ado, let’s get started!

item.description: A very good day to all you yuzu fans out there! Today we are here to share with you some very exciting news for our biggest supporters!

item.title: Progress Report 2018 Part 4
item.author: CaptV0rt3x
item.description: Sorry for keeping you guys waiting! A whole slew of new updates and a ton of progress await you. Let’s not waste anymore time and get the party started.

item.title: Progress Report 2018 Part 3
item.author: CaptV0rt3x
item.description: It’s only been over a month since our last report, and we have made so much progress already that we simply can’t wait to share it with you guys. Without further ado, let’s dive in.

item.title: Progress Report 2018 Part 2
item.author: CaptV0rt3x
item.description:
We bring you part 2 of the extensive coverage on yuzu’s tremendous progress. So buckle up for an exciting ride, cause its gonna blow your mind!  

Haven’t read the first part yet? Read it here

item.title: Progress Report 2018 Part 1
item.author: CaptV0rt3x
item.description: It’s been a bumpy ride. We have had lots of stuff happen to yuzu and we are excited to share that with you. Let’s get started!

item.title: First games are running!
item.author: jmc47
item.description: A major milestone in yuzu has been reached, as it can now boot a handful of the Nintendo Switch’s more primitive games. Don’t believe us? Take a look!
